title: Summer Sailstice
description:
There is a Drupal-based site where different boat-owners can organize to sail together - the "Sail events". There are about 25,000 different users and more than 5,000 different events and personal plans. Also, there are a sponsorship system with about 30-50 different sponsors, blog, news, prizes, contests etc.

I've created about all of the site with some help from my kind colleagues with a main "Events" map. I configured backend (content types, block structure, views, custom settings), migrated database from Drupal 7 and updated frontend (except the dots on the map). Totally, we've create 6 custom drupal plugins and 1 theme.

This project is my first real-world experience with database migration, advanced using of Drupal and maps - Google map and Leaflet. I really liked the power of command line, caching, views and template system.

title: Klaus Mäs
description:
There is a Wordpress based business website about german architectural bureau 'Klaus Mäs'. Clean and informative design with a well-described projects and answers to a commonly asked questions give a great first impression to potential clients.

The website was fully developed by me. Mockup is pixel-perfect to received Sketch design. Also, I've added some animations, transitions and preloader. Technically, I wrote just a wordpress theme from scratch (underscores basic template). Used SCSS with CLI compiling.

I really like the design and animations. My current portfolio has the same style but with some more colors and icons and without vertical text.

title: Access Infinity
description:
There is a Wordpress-based site for a pharma companies consulting services 'Access Infinity'. The company lets access to the markets more easier through giving different data to the client in a comfortable way.

Site was build fully be my over a 'Uniq' theme from Envato market, with some additional SCSS styling and javascript coding. Design required a lot of attention to the details, e.g. colliding of 2 images at the home page with color changing on the collision place.

That was the first time I worked with a WP theme from Envato market.

title: RNID (AOHL)
description:
There is an Engaging network-based donation page. The company is also called AOHL (action on hearing loss). The page is just a donation form to collect money for treatment of hearing-loss people.

Our company has build recently similar template. So I had some basic similar template, which required new styling and some new scripts. The history widget at the left was created fully by me.

This is a first my real-world project.

title: Gordon Bay Marine
description:
There is a Drupal-based shop of one of Canada’s largest boat dealers. The company was founded in the 1960 and is targeted to provide the besu user experience.

The site wasn't build by me - I just modified and added some functionality to the shop. E.g. receiving webcamera data and update it in the user's view. Also, I've added some additional stylings and forms.

This time I was as second developer and just speed-up the development.

title: Task manager
description:
This is a more simpler Trello clone. You can drag-n-drop cards in to columns, there is the same data structure: boards-columns-tasks. I think, every front end developer, who learned JS, have to build such a project 😏, because it shows an ability of a person to learn different libraries (such as react-beatiful-dnd).

This project uses "react-beatiful-dnd" library for handling Drag-n-Drop functionality, local browser storage to store project's data. I also use Redux for handling state changes: CRUD operations with cards, columns. I also connect every Redux change to the local storage.

title: Sortable table
description:
This is an example of custom created sorted functionality with JavaScript. Also, I tried to create my JS in a shape of a module. So, to add this functionality to another place, I'll just have to add a single JS file - this is perfect, as I think.

The type of sorting (string, number, bool) is declared on the <th> element.
